actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from 72 to 70 the age beyond which deductions on account of an individual's outside earnings will no longer be made from such individual's benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Reduces, under title II (Old-Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act, from 72 to 70 the age beyond which deductions on account of an individual's outside earnings will no longer be made from such individual's benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from 72 to 70 the age beyond which deductions on account of an individual's outside earnings will no longer be made from such individual's benefits.
